text.content:
NURSING NOTE 
    1930 - 0800
 
 
 
        See electronic flowsheet via CPRS Tools menu for VS, systems assessment, 
I/O, 
IV line assessment. 
 
        CODE status: 
Full Code / Full Resuscitative Efforts 
 
    Patient identification is confirmed by an accurate secured armband
         YES
 
    Are restraints in use? 
         No.
 
    Has there been a FALL in the past 48 hours? 
         No
P: pt at risk for falls
 
I: pt. oriented to unit, call light and encouraged to use it. 
 
E: Pt. A&Ox3, VSS except pt with slight temp at beginning of shift- 100.6, 
however has been afebrile since without intervention. Patient was noted to be 
sinus rhythm per telemetry at beginning of shift. Pt pleasant,
cooperative. MRSA negative. Pt wishes to not have compressions, but yes to
intubation- no bracelet placed on patient. Lung sounds diminished t/o all
lobes, active bowel sounds, continent clear yellow urine per patient.
Regular diet. 20g to Left Hand flushing well. tylenol available prn. pt
wishing to sleep, states has no pain and no other complaints.
 
BED BUG ASSESSMENT: 
Patient has been assessed for the presence of bed bugs and/or bed bug bites. No 
evidence of bed bugs noted.
PATIENT EDUCATION
   BARRIERS TO LEARNING
   Patient:  No observed barriers to learning 
   Comments: 
   Family/Significant Other: 
   Comments: 
   Information Taught: 
   To Whom: Patient
 
   Method:  verbal 
 
   Learner Response:  Indicates Understanding 
 
   Comments:  ENCOURAGED TO USE CALL LIGHT FOR ASSISTANCE/GETTING UP
MORSE FALL SCALE
 
   History of Falls   0 Yes
   Secondary Dx      15 Yes
   Ambulatory Aid     0 Crutches/Cane/Walker
   IV/Hep Lock       20 Yes
   Gait/Transfer     10 Weak
   Mental Status      0 Oriented to own ability
 
   TOTAL SCORE:      45
 
GENITOURINARY 
Voiding without difficulty, BRP.
text.author: NURSE,TWENTY-SEVEN
